Author: greendestiny
Content: Great code is simple. Simplicity is the cornerstone of all the other attributes of beautiful code - ease of extension, ease of understanding, often even efficiency or at least amenability to optimization.

Author: henning
Title: Ask: famous Greenspun's Tenth Rule manifestations?
Content:
Here are some examples I'm aware of of large software systems bucking at the brutally low-level nature of their implementation language:

- Mozilla/Firefox - XPCOM, a COM/CORBA-like thing the codebase has, implements message passing and garbage collection.

- (allegedly) Yahoo's rewrite of Viaweb

- X Windows, though I've never studied its source code so I don't know for sure

- Apache: implemented using the "Apache Portable Runtime" library that provides things like hash tables and memory mapping.

Are there any other instances you're aware of?
